# Welcome to the tutorial on Dashboards

![Welcome Illustration](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99418889-c1e75e00-28fb-11eb-90ea-607e0ba43c57.png)

Your dashboard shows a combination of data charts, tables, maps that you have created on a particular topic. This tutorial takes you through the steps of creating new dashboards and navigating through their features to explore your data.

pages.referenceValue:
![Select your dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355239-37c1da00-28a8-11eb-9d56-30eed933abf4.gif)

The dashboards that are available for you to explore are listed at the top of the screen. Click 'Show more' to see the full list. Click on the dashboard name to open each dashboard and view data on the different topics.

![Select your dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355240-37c1da00-28a8-11eb-9d5c-7702adb39606.gif)

You can also search for a specific dashboard by typing in its name or keywords next to the lens icon.

![Explore dashboard features](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355242-385a7080-28a8-11eb-9321-6de81b40ea01.gif)

If you use some dashboards more frequently than others, you can make these 'Favourites' by clicking on the star next to your dashboard name. This moves your dashboard to the front of the list on your dashboard menu.

Click on the 'i' button to read the description of your dashboard. This gives users more information about the theme and content of your dashboard.

![Explore interactive chart features](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355244-385a7080-28a8-11eb-84d2-4e1a2080ea32.gif)

The data visualisations are interactive. On charts, hover over the data to highlight specific series and view more information about the data. Click on the category names or colours in the legend to hide or show data.

![Explore interactive chart features](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355245-38f30700-28a8-11eb-94f3-2468e92dfb00.gif)

On maps, zoom in and out by double clicking or using the zoom buttons on the map menu. You can also pan across the map by clicking and dragging.

Open the legend on the map menu to see what data is being shown.

Click on the data shown on maps to view more information about the individual data points.

![Explore interactive chart features](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355246-38f30700-28a8-11eb-8013-b34a7ea8998d.gif)

On tables, sort the data from highest to lowest or vice versa by clicking on the column names.

![Change data visualisation type](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355250-38f30700-28a8-11eb-8019-659cba9d8423.gif)

Click on the button with three dots in the top right corner of any data visualisation. The options on this menu allow you to view your data as different visualisation types (see options to 'View as Table', 'View as Map' or 'View as Chart').

You can also click on the 'Open in Data Visualizer app' to edit your visualisations.

Select 'Show interpretations and details' to add comments on the visualisations, and review comments from other users.

![Filter data across charts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355253-398b9d80-28a8-11eb-8003-01f488075b9c.gif)

When you click 'Filter', you can choose to filter the data on the dashboard to only show a specific location (also called an Organisation Unit), time period or other category. The filters that you select apply across all the data visualisations in your dashboard.

![Create new dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355225-35f81680-28a8-11eb-942a-0f522306e355.gif)

Click on the green icon with the plus sign to create a new dashboard.

On the new screen, type in the name of your dashboard in the space under 'Dashboard title' to help you identify the type of data that will be visualised here in future.

Under 'Dashboard description', type in a short description of your dashboard so you and other users know what the theme is and what content is included in the dashboard.

![Add visualisations to dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355228-3690ad00-28a8-11eb-8ba2-53e2afaf4ed4.gif)

Click the space under the heading 'Search for items to add to this dashboard'. A drop-down menu of elements including charts, tables and maps that you have created will appear.

Click on the visualisations from the list to add them into the empty dashboard.

You can also type keywords to search for specific visualisations.

![Reorganize dashboard layout](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355231-37294380-28a8-11eb-80a4-84e4e400fb02.gif)

Click and drag the visualisations to reorganize the dashboard. You can also resize each individual window by clicking and dragging their borders at the bottom right.

Delete data visualisations from your dashboard by clicking on the red bin icon on the window that you no longer want to include.

title.referenceValue: Save, edit or delete your dashboard

pages.referenceValue:
![Save, edit or delete your dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355233-37294380-28a8-11eb-9cc2-4d2510731809.gif)

Click 'Save changes' to save your dashboard.

At any point, you can edit the layout and content of your dashboard by clicking 'Edit' on the main dashboard screen. Remember to save your changes when you are done.

You can also delete your dashboard from the edit menu by clicking 'Delete' at the top of the screen.

![Share your dashboard](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2181866/99355237-37294380-28a8-11eb-834c-9c1cd4062f72.gif)

To share your dashboard with other users of DHIS2, click 'Share'. Users can be public, external or internal.

Change who can view and edit your dashboard by allowing Public or External access to other DHIS2 users on the 'Sharing settings' window. You can also share the dashboard with selected users or user groups by adding in their names at the bottom of the window.

You have the option to give them the right to only view or view and edit your dashboard when you click on the pencil.
